channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2023080203
item.description:
Report E-2023080203

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the one case of ph reducer (un1789) had an defective inner one gallon poly bottle and that 1 quart had been released. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023080296
item.description:
Report X-2023080296

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-22
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived wet at OKLA731. Package came from SDRS765 trailer 554395. Neutralizer powder was used to contain the sulfuric acid before safely cleaning up. The package was placed in a hazmat tote upon discovery. DescribePack: Contents were broken and leaked caused by the impact of being dropped 3 feet from the roller's edge while being loaded onto the trailer. Contents are sulfuric acid. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The package, in a hazmat tote, is then isolated and secured in a hazmat cage.

item.title: Report E-2023080033
item.description:
Report E-2023080033

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 14, 2023, one (1) 48-pound box of HA powder (UN3262) was forked and released one (1) pound of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. LSH neutralized the released material and utilized absorbents to collect the spent product. All clean up debris and the damaged box were contained in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The drum was labeled and staged onsite for profiling and disposal by R+L personnel.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading the trailer, one battery was found damaged and leaking. The release was properly managed. The damaged battery was placed into a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

  • Description: Driver connecting unloading hose discovered material in piping from loading operation. Some material released during hose connection. Piping drained, connections made and unloading completed without additional incident.
